bibl.title: Despatch from M. A. Aenmey to William Hunter
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: Second Assistant U.S. Secretary of State

div1.p:
United States Consulate General at Monrovia
to the Department of State

M. A. Aenmey to
the Honl Second Assistant Secretary of State

United States Consulate General
Monrovia February 15th 1882.

To
The Honl Second Assistant Secretary of State
Washington D.C.

I must respectfully beg to inform you that at the 13th of February, the date of the death of the late Honl Henry Highland Garnet, I have took charge of the office, assuming the duties of the same, until the arival of the successor or the pleasure of the department is knowing otherwise.
I will inform the Department at the first opportunity the state and condition of office room and inventory

with assurance of my highest esteem
I am Sir
Your obedient Servant
M. A. Aenmey
U.S. Vice Consul General.
